intro: Actinochloa bromoides, commonly known as the ghost grass, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
